DataElement.preferredName: Biospecimen Difference From Standard Operating Procedure Size Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The size of a collected specimen if different from the size specified in the standard operating procedure (units mm X mm X mm).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Biospecimen Difference From Standard Operating Procedure Size
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products._The quality of being unlike or dissimilar._Used to indicate a specified place or time as a starting point; used to indicate a source, cause, agent, or instrument._An established procedure to be followed in carrying out a given operation or in a given situation._The physical magnitude of something.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Concepts.definition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Concepts.definition: The quality of being unlike or dissimilar.
Used to indicate a specified place or time as a starting point; used to indicate a source, cause, agent, or instrument.
An established procedure to be followed in carrying out a given operation or in a given situation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The free-text field used to capture the physical magnitude of a specimen.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.:Size; the physical magnitude of something.:Text; the words of something written.

Concepts.definition: A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.
